main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted in Middlesex, New Jersey on 06/02/54, described as having landing lights similar to an airplane but appeared circular with windows when closer and had a steady floating motion before disappearing towards the southeast.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be an aircraft but exhibited unusual characteristics upon closer observation., The object passed dangerously close to an eastbound transport, though the pilot reported no sighting., There are similarities to satellite decay, yet the object's trajectory was inconsistent with that., Despite the proximity of the object, no official reports were recorded from other pilots during the sighting., Documentation referenced includes communications about weather data relating to the sighting.
sighted object: A roughly circular object with what appeared to be windows, resembling an aircraft
witness description: The report does not specify any witnesses.
